thread.title: Roundup: McNeil picks up first District 13-6A victory
thread.title_full: Roundup: McNeil picks up first District 13-6A victory

author: Sean Shapiro
title: Roundup: McNeil picks up first District 13-6A victory
text:
Roundup: McNeil picks up first District 13-6A victory 11:46 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 | Filed in: High School ﻿ Story Highlights 
McNeil scored 17 second-quarter points Thursday night in a 24-7 triumph over winless Westwood, giving the Mavericks their initial district victory of the season. 
Hayden Cooper scored on a pair of 1-yard fourth-down runs, and he also helped set up a field goal in the second quarter at Reeves Athletic Complex. 
“The second quarter, we just had to step up and get some points on the board,” Cooper said. “It’s the first time I’ve ever beaten them so that makes this special.” Jamie Harms Westwood running back Te’shon McGinnis carries against McNeil on Thursday night. CREDIT: Jamie Harms/For American-Statesman 
Cooper, the Mavericks’ senior quarterback, finished with 70 rushing yards and passed for 44 more. He also hauled in a 29-yard reception on a halfback pass from David Pleites on a trick play in the second quarter. 
“I’m just happy they gave me the ball,” Cooper said. “I keep telling people I have good hands.” 
Justin Ward rushed for 90 yards on 17 carries for McNeil (2-4, 1-2 in District 13-6A), scoring on a 20-yard touchdown run with 49 seconds to play. Jamie Harms McNeil quarterback Hayden Cooper breaks into the open field on Thursday night, when the Mavericks defeated Westwood 24-7 in a District 13-6A contest. CREDIT: Jamie Harms/For American-Statesman 
McNeil’s defense held Westwood to 169 total yards and defused two potential scoring drives when Josh Adenji secured an interception in the second quarter and a fake field-goal play failed for the Warriors in the fourth quarter. 
Westwood quarterback Jack Swensen completed 14 of 26 passes for 113 yards, including four passes to Josh Burton for 58 yards. 
Sophomore linebacker Jaikem Murphy snagged an interception for the Warriors (0-6, 0-3). McNeil vs. Westwood, 10.08.15 
Crockett 31, Travis 27: Zach Ochoa capped a 62-yard fourth-quarter touchdown drive with a 38-yard pass to Jordon Toupin as Crockett rallied to edge edge Travis in a District 26-5A contest at Burger Stadium. 
The Rebels had a chance to win, but Breonn Watson’s pass to the end zone fell incomplete on the last play of the game. 
Ochoa finished with 322 yards of offense, completing 13 of 25 passes for 210 yards and three touchdowns while also rushing for 112 yards on 25 carries. 
Toupin finished with a game-high five catches for 96 yards as Crockett (1-5) picked up its first district win after two losses. 
Watson had a hand in all four of Travis’ touchdowns. He threw a 12-yard scoring pass to Boris Vindou and also rushed for touchdowns of 2, 1 and 5 yards. His 5-yard carry pushed the Rebels into the lead with 5:11 to go in the final quarter. 
The Rebels’ Elias Millet-Troche topped all ball-carriers as he churned out 137 yards on 18 carries. Watson added 73 yards on 18 totes. 
Crockett faces Lanier next week while the Rebels (0-6, 0-3) will take on Reagan. 
— Mark Champ, AA-S correspondent
